I want a very simple thing: This

if you dont have idea of spanish, look the photos, there are in english and are very helpful

[http://danielmarin.naukas.com/2012/10/14/proyecto-moose-o-como-hacer-que-el-salto-de-baumgartner-quede-en-una-nimiedad/](http://danielmarin.naukas.com/2012/10/14/proyecto-moose-o-como-hacer-que-el-salto-de-baumgartner-quede-en-una-nimiedad/)

Ah, personal portable heat shield + parachute for human.

The kerbal has something better though - their helmets. Try landing a kerbal on their helmet. Fun stuff.

This idea has been around for a long time. I remember it being picked up for the role-playing game *Traveller*, and it had been the subject of NASA studies then. That's over 35 years. And it isn't far off from the drops in *Starship Troopers*, though that was rather different. [But real tests were done a half-century ago.](http://www.jamesoberg.com/112003irv_his.html)

With current Kerbal tech I could make something now. There's a Hangar set with includes a lander Hanger, to get you rovers onto moons and planets more easily. Comes with an add-on heat shield. But it could be any small object, unless you're using real reentry mods.

For the look I'd use a ROUND-8 Toroidal Fuel Tank with an EAS-1 External Command Seat and a parachute. It might need a strut to connect things. Would the Kerbal's jetpack have enough delta-V to start a reentry from a low orbit. It could start getting a little complicated. The smallest size reaction wheel set and 3 or 4 separatrons?

It wouldn't be so hard to make a small heat-shield that could carry an EAS-1 and a parachute.
There's a USI mod with a tiny inflatable lifeboat around.

> 
> Yep, you probably want this:
> [http://i.imgur.com/Ok7NVwo.png](http://i.imgur.com/Ok7NVwo.png)

Or the Pteron or WEKA tiny shuttles.
